intro: Pseudosmodingium barkleyi, commonly known as the Florida rockcress, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants, and is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in open habitats such as sand dunes and coastal bluffs. It has a low-growing habit with succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid environment. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
